title: 110_hr4229
content: The Act may be cited as the "Department of Veterans Affairs Management Accountability Act of 2007". It establishes a Department of Veterans Affairs Bonus Review Board. The Department of Veterans Affairs Management Accountability Act of 2007 establishes a Bonus Review Board to review ratings, bonuses, and pay adjustments for covered employees of the Department and make recommendations to the Secretary. The Board must review proposals from the performance review board at least 30 days before the Secretary can award any rating, bonus, or pay adjustment. The Bonus Review Board reviews and recommends ratings, bonuses, and pay adjustments for Department of Veterans Affairs employees. The Board considers the Department's performance in the previous fiscal year, focusing on claims backlog and waiting times at medical facilities. The Secretary cannot award any rating, bonus, or pay adjustment without the Board's recommendation. The Board consists of six members appointed by the chairman. The Bonus Review Board consists of six members appointed by the chairman of the Committees on Veterans' Affairs from the House of Representatives and the Senate. Members must not have any affiliation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, must have business experience, and serve a three-year term. The Bonus Review Board consists of six members appointed for three-year terms. Members serve without compensation but receive travel expenses. The Board meets at least once annually, and the Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to it. The Bonus Review Board, exempt from the Advisory Committee Act, covers employees in Senior Executive Service positions or appointed by the President. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress on bonuses awarded to covered employees. The Bonus Review Board oversees bonuses for Senior Executive Service employees or those appointed by the President. The Secretary must report to Congress on the board's recommendations and bonuses awarded to covered employees. The report must include details such as the names of board members, number of bonus proposals, recommended bonuses, bonuses awarded, and recipients' names and amounts. Section 713 of title 38, United States Code, added by this Act, applies to ratings, bonuses, or pay adjustments awarded by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs 60 days after the enactment date.
